subject: Self Care
title: Money and Happiness
description: A fast breakdown of Money and Happiness for builders.

hook.text: Money buys happiness â€” up to a point. After basic needs are met, more money adds surprisingly little life satisfaction.

buildup.text: The famous Kahneman study found emotional well-being plateaus around $75,000 per year in the US. Above that, gains shrink.

discovery.text: How you spend matters more than how much you have. Spending on experiences and others produces more joy than spending on yourself.

twist.text: Wealthy people who prioritize time over money are happier than those who prioritize money over time. Time is the real currency.

climax.text: Once needs are met, invest in time freedom, experiences, and generosity. These purchases have the best happiness returns.

punchline.text: After basic needs, buy time and experiences. Not more stuff.

quiz.question: What type of spending produces the most lasting happiness?
options: Spending on experiences and on other people
